definition: to get angry/to burn with rage
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
surname Mao
old variant of 冒[mao4]
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: A tongue on fire, can the flames vanish?
sentences.chinese: 冒火的舌头，你的火焰能消失吗？

sentences.english: He had been growing nettled before, but now he pulled himself together.
sentences.chinese: 他本来有些冒火，但这会儿他又恢复了常态。

sentences.english: It maddened him to think that he did not have a winer choice of action.
sentences.chinese: 他一想到自己没有更多的选择余地，就不由得直冒火。

sentences.english: These are a collection of some of the phrases that piss me off most.
sentences.chinese: 以下是一个最让我冒火的话的小集锦。

sentences.english: He certainly will see red should you start criticizing his work.
sentences.chinese: 假如你开始批评他的工作，他一定会冒火。

sentences.english: His eyes suddenly blazed with anger.
sentences.chinese: 他愤怒得双眼突然冒火。

sentences.english: My throat is still on fire.
sentences.chinese: 现在我的喉咙还在冒火。

sentences.english: His laugh really gets under my skin.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑声真是让我冒火。

sentences.english: I fumed as I pulled into the garage.
sentences.chinese: 在我开车进车库的时候心里已经冒火了。

sentences.english: Her eyes blazed when she saw him cheating.
sentences.chinese: 当她看见他行骗时，她双眼直冒火。

sentences.english: Eyes inside has already started getting very angry, small work properly son but be seen the heart bottom convey chilly.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛里已经开始冒火，小灵子却被看得心底发凉。

sentences.english: 'Because I'm trying to drive!' he replied, exasperated.
sentences.chinese: “因为我在开车”鲍勃冒火的回答道。

definition: to get mad/to be very angry
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to get really angry
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
very red/red through and through/to blush (deep red)
rage/fury/hot anger
red in the face/extremely angry
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
very fierce
(onom.) beating of the heart/pitapat/pulsation of a machine
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to get angry/to fume
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
ominous glint
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
